translation.en: It came to me in a dream.
translation.ja: それは夢のお告げだった

translation.en: Hair is beauty.
Hair is emotion.
Hair is our heritage.
Hair tells us who we are, where we've been, and where we're going.
translation.ja: 髪は自分らしさ 髪は私たちの過去と未来

translation.en: - My name is Sarah Breedlove. -
translation.ja: 私はサラ･ブリードラブ

translation.en: Making products for our hair is my passion.
translation.ja: ヘアケア製品に 情熱を注いでる

translation.en: Hasn't been easy,
but no matter what, I refuse to give up the fight.
translation.ja: でも 私は 絶対にあきらめない

translation.en: Addie Munroe's Magical Hair Grower!
translation.ja: アディーの魔法の育毛剤(マジカル･ヘアグロウ)！

translation.en: Fifty cents a tin. Get Magical Hair Grower right here!
translation.ja: 一つ 50セント　 マジカル･ヘアグロウ！

translation.en: You got dandruff, ma'am?
You got bald patches?
Hair that won't grow? I got your fix! Right here, ladies!
translation.ja: 髪が伸びない女性には これ

translation.en: Magical Hair Grow--
Heard of that stuff.
Do it work?
Saved my life.
Hair is power.
You can't imagine what it's like to lose it.
translation.ja: 髪を失うのが どんなにつらいことか…

translation.en: Seems like I was born to struggle.
translation.ja: 私の人生は苦労だらけ

translation.en: The life of a washerwoman is hard.
translation.ja: 洗濯婦の人生は苦しい

translation.en: I'd scrub my fingers to the bone for pennies.
translation.ja: わずかな収入のために 指をすり減らす

translation.en: Most days, I can't even make ends meet.
translation.ja: それでも ぎりぎりの生活

translation.en: After a while, I guess I just lost hope-- forgot how to dream.
translation.ja: そのうちに希望を失い 夢を抱くことも忘れた

translation.en: That's when my hair started falling out.
translation.ja: そのころ 髪が抜け始めた

translation.en: My husband Davis only made things worse.
translation.ja: 夫のデイヴィスが 状況を悪化させた

translation.en: He was arrested, and when he came back, he was a changed man.
translation.ja: 夫は逮捕されて人が変わった

translation.en: You look like a mangy dog.
- Baby, wait, don't go. - No.
Please. Davis.
I was devastated.
Didn't know what I was gonna do.
I used to wonder if God don't like ugly,
translation.ja: 神様は 醜いものが お嫌いなら―

translation.en: why did he make me?
With so much beauty in this world, how come I got so little?
translation.ja: この世は美であふれてるのに なぜ私は醜いの？

translation.en: And then everything changed.
translation.ja: ある日 すべてが変わった

translation.en: I'm Addie Munroe, and I would like to talk with you
translation.ja: アディー･マンローです 商品の紹介を

translation.en: about my new hair product.
You all right?
Is anyone here?
I'm-- I'm gonna help you.
It's gonna be just fine.
Oh, it's okay.
What happened?
I started using the Hair Grower that day.
translation.ja: ヘアグロウを使い始めたら―

translation.en: In a few months' time, my hair came back.
translation.ja: 数ヵ月で毛が生えてきた

translation.en: Look at how your hair is growing.
Thanks to you.
I don't know why I'm so surprised. My Magical Hair Grower is magical.
translation.ja: でも驚かないわ 魔法の育毛剤だもの

translation.en: Yes, indeed, Addie.
Yes, indeed.
Addie's Hair Grower worked. My hair grew back.
translation.ja: アディーの育毛剤のおかげで 髪だけでなく―

translation.en: And so did my confidence.
Now I got me a new man, CJ, who loves me and treats me right.
translation.ja: 私を大事にしてくれる 男性にも出会ったの

translation.en: My hair grew back so good, I thought, maybe I could sell it myself.
translation.ja: ほんとによく効いたから 自分でも売ってみたかった

translation.en: That's why I wanna sell your Hair Grower.
translation.ja: だから ぜひお試しを

translation.en: That's why I wanna sell your Hair Grower.
translation.ja: だから ぜひお試しを

translation.en: That's why I wanna sell your Hair Grower.
translation.ja: だから ぜひお試しを

translation.en: But what do I say when the customers complain about the sulfur smell?
translation.ja: お客様に“硫黄臭い”って 言われたら？

translation.en: Oh, smile and say, That's how you know the product is working.
translation.ja: “それは効いてる証拠”って 笑顔で言うの

translation.en: Here.
I put it on at night. Tie it up real good.
translation.ja: 寝る前につけて 縛っておくと―

translation.en: By morning, the smell's gone. Mostly.
translation.ja: 朝には においが消えてる

translation.en: Now that's a tasty idea. Thanks.
translation.ja: それはいいアイデアね ありがとう

translation.en: If a washerwoman like Sarah can figure it out, y'all should have no problem.
translation.ja: 洗濯婦のサラでも 分かるんだから 大丈夫

translation.en: You've just got to convince the customers
that by using my product, that they'll look like me.
translation.ja: 私みたいになれるって 言って

translation.en: Or you all, at least.
What?
No. No...
But, it... It works. Trust me.
translation.ja: でも それでうまくいくの

translation.en: You gals will be fine. You'll get the hang of it soon.
translation.ja: あなたたちも すぐ覚える

translation.en: In the meantime, just smile a lot.
translation.ja: とにかく 笑顔を絶やさないこと

translation.en: They just get younger and dumber, don't they?
translation.ja: 若い子が ますますバカになってる

translation.en: Maybe I could sell your product.
translation.ja: 私も販売員になれたら―

translation.en: I'd be honored, in fact.
Oh.
I don't think sales is for you.
translation.ja: セールスは 難しいんじゃないかしら

translation.en: I've been singing your praises for almost two years.
translation.ja: この２年間に私のおかげで―

translation.en: I got you, what? Eight new customers?
Mmm. That's not the same as selling door- to- door, though.
translation.ja: 訪問販売は また別よ

translation.en: Oh, I know everything about Hair Grower. I'm proof that it works.
translation.ja: 製品の知識もあるし 歩く広告になる

translation.en: Sarah, I know what I'm doing.
It's business.
Nothing personal.
Hiring a bunch of mulatto gals to con folks ain't gonna work.
translation.ja: 混血の娘(こ)を雇っても無駄よ

translation.en: Even a fool knows they didn't get good hair from your product. Their mamas and grandmamas got raped.
translation.ja: 髪が美しいのは 母親がレイプされたせい

translation.en: Language.
All I'm saying is... when a customer looks at my hair,
translation.ja: でも お客は 私の髪を見れば―

translation.en: they'll know they're seeing what your product can do.
translation.ja: 本当に効くんだって分かる

translation.en: Colored women will do anything to look like me.
translation.ja: 黒人女性は 私みたいになりたいの

translation.en: Even if deep down they know they can't.
translation.ja: 無理だと分かっていてもね

translation.en: Now we've got a good arrangement here.
translation.ja: 今のままでいいじゃない

translation.en: Laundry for hair treatments. Let's not complicate things.
translation.ja: トリートメントの代わりに 洗濯してもらう

translation.en: You saw the laundry in the back.
I'll have it for you on Friday.
I was hesitant at first, but then I realized...
translation.ja: 初めは迷ったけど すぐに確信した

translation.en: this is my calling.
That I could help others the way Addie helped me.
translation.ja: “今度は私が 人を助ける番だ”って

translation.en: And that's why I'm here.
It worked for me.
It'll work for y'all.
That's one hell of a story.
Give me one tin.
Thank you.
Me too.
- I'll take one. - How much is it?
translation.ja: 私も 髪が伸びるって？

translation.en: She said it grow hair?
Thank you, baby.
It's worth the money.
I can't wait to try!
Let me know how you doin' with it. Check back in.
- All right, then! - Thank you!
♪They just wanna talk that stuff Till I hit 'em with the realness ♪
- Sarah? What are you doin' here? - I did it.
translation.ja: サラ　どうしたの？ 成功よ

translation.en: I sold 20 tins.
What now?
I borrowed a few tins of your Hair Grower.
After I told you no?
Just to see if I could sell 'em!
But you can't. It don't make sense!
- I figured if I just showed you-- - You stole from me?
translation.ja: 証明を… 盗んだのね

translation.en: After everything I've done for you?
No, I'd never steal from you! I brought all the money. It's all for you!
translation.ja: 売上げは全部渡します

translation.en: I got you back on your feet.
I confided in you.
How could you?
I just wanted to show you that I can sell.
We can make a lot of money together. I got ideas--
Are you out of your mind?
Even in your Sunday best,
you look like you just stepped off the plantation.
translation.ja: 農園の奴隷にしか見えない

translation.en: These are my products.
And I will not have the likes of you associated with them.
translation.ja: あんたなんかには扱わせない

translation.en: Sorry for overstepping.
It won't happen again.
Sarah!
For Addie's newest sales agent.
translation.ja: アディーの新しい販売員に！

translation.en: What happened?
I ain't got the right look.
Now, wait a minute, now you...
You're the most beautiful woman in the world.
- Stop. - No.
All these years I done made ads, I'd drawn every type of face there is.
translation.ja: 俺は広告であらゆる顔を 描いてるが

translation.en: And ain't none more beautiful than yours.
Tell me what happened.
She treated me like I was nothing, CJ.
translation.ja: ゴミみたいに扱われた

translation.en: I thought we was friends.
Week after week, I sat in that chair. Told her stuff I ain't never told nobody.
translation.ja: 何でも打ち明けてたのに―

translation.en: I should've known I was just a customer to her.
translation.ja: 私はただのお客だった

translation.en: And an ugly one at that.
Okay, stop. I ain't gonna let you keep beating up on yourself, you hear?
translation.ja: もういい 自分をおとしめるな

translation.en: You hear me?
I love you, CJ.
What you makin'?
From now on, I'm doing my own hair, making my own hair grower.
translation.ja: これからは 自分で育毛剤を作るの

translation.en: I'm through with Addie Munroe.
Mama!
What you doin' up?
Just workin' on a little something. Sit, there's something I wanna try.
translation.ja: ちょっとね そこに座って

translation.en: What is it?
Hair grower. Maybe.
Just something I'm fiddling around with.
Mmm. Smells better than Addie's already.
translation.ja: アディーのより いい匂い

translation.en: Just trying to figure out the right mix.
Where you been?
Ray Ray's Bar was hot tonight,
and me and John was dancing the Big Bear Dance all night long.
translation.ja: ジョンと一晩中 踊ってた 素敵だったわよ

translation.en: Just... mm- mm- mmm.
- John, huh? - Mm- hmm.
The guitar player?
Sit... Sit your behind down!
What did I tell you about that sponger?
You ain't even met him yet.
I can tell by the way you talk about him, he ain't got no money.
translation.ja: 金がないことぐらい分かる

translation.en: I know you think I'm puttin' on airs.
But...
you ain't cute or clever enough
to survive gettin' knocked up by some do- nothin' musician.
translation.ja: あんな男の子供でもできたら おしまいだよ

translation.en: Gotta find somebody who'll make your life better. Like CJ.
translation.ja: ＣＪみたいな 立派な男を探しなさい

translation.en: Not having this conversation again.
translation.ja: もう その話はやめて

translation.en: You're too idle.
You need to call Dr. Collins.
He stood me up, remember?
That glass eye he got give me the willies.
So? He's a doctor. And you ain't gettin' much younger.
translation.ja: お医者さんなら いいじゃないの

translation.en: You either go to college or find yourself a husband, you hear?
translation.ja: そろそろ大学か結婚か 決めなさい

translation.en: - - What's wrong?
My scalp is on fire, Mama.
Okay, that's the last time I make it with lye. Come on!
translation.ja: そうか　灰汁(あく)はダメだね

translation.en: Ooh! Just gotta get it out.
- - Thank you, sister Sarah.
My hair grew two inches!
God bless you.
Hair Grower works!
Mama, you did it! You made a beautiful hair grower.
translation.ja: ママ やったね！　偉い！

translation.en: I'm so proud of you.
- Here you go. - Okay.
Sarah, I hear you. Open up.
translation.ja: いるんでしょ　開けて

translation.en: Just a minute!
Addie.
Sarah.
A few weeks ago, you left clean laundry on my doorstep. Then, nothing.
translation.ja: 数週間 ずっと 音沙汰がないから―

translation.en: Thought maybe the Klan got you.
Well, been a little sick.
translation.ja: 体の具合が悪かったの

translation.en: You might not wanna get too close.
You can imagine my surprise when I heard Sarah Breedlove not only lives...
translation.ja: でも驚いた　 サラはピンピンして―

translation.en: but is out testing hair grower.
- Me? That ain't-- - Better not be my tins.
translation.ja: 私が？ また私から盗んだ？

translation.en: Rest assured...
we're settled up.
You really think you can compete with me?
translation.ja: 本当に私と競争する気？

translation.en: Suit yourself,
but you'll fail soon enough.
And when you do,
I got a hamper full of dirty laundry with your name on it.
translation.ja: 洗濯物を ためておいてあげる

translation.en: - CJ! - Hmm?
- CJ! - Hmm?
Your sister wants me to send her 20 jars of Hair Grower,
translation.ja: お義姉(ねえ)さんが 20個注文してくれた

translation.en: and she sent me money.
Peg-- Peggie sent money?
It's a miracle!
I think God is finally smiling down on me.
translation.ja: やっと神様が助けてくれた

translation.en: She said she let her choir director try some of the product I sent, and now all the sopranos want it.
translation.ja: 聖歌隊のソプラノが 全員 買ってくれるんだって

translation.en: Huh. It says here, more Negroes are moving to Indianapolis.
translation.ja: インディアナポリスに 黒人が流れ込んでる

translation.en: Property is cheap now on account of the recession and factories closing.
translation.ja: 不況と工場閉鎖で 不動産価格が下がったせいだ

translation.en: As soon as Negroes move in, white folks run for the hills.
translation.ja: 白人が郊外へ 逃げ出してるのね

translation.en: - - Can you imagine?
Ofays go broke and they just up and close a factory, I mean, a whole factory, just like that.
translation.ja: 白人は すぐあきらめて 工場を閉めちまう

translation.en: Mmm. How is Cleophus gettin' along all by his lonesome?
translation.ja: クレオファスは 一人で大丈夫？

translation.en: - Only your sister to look after him? - Daddy's doin' just fine.
translation.ja: クレオファスは 一人で大丈夫？ おやじは大丈夫さ

translation.en: What you gettin' at?
My product is just as good as Addie's. Maybe better.
translation.ja: 私の育毛剤は アディーのよりいい

translation.en: Definitely smells better.
I can't be a washerwoman for the rest of my life, CJ.
translation.ja: 一生 洗濯婦でいたくない

translation.en: Miss Jessie said there's three million Negro women in America.
translation.ja: アメリカには黒人女性が 300万人いる

translation.en: If I can get 'em all to buy just one jar of Hair Grower, I'll be a millionaire.
translation.ja: 一人が一個買ってくれたら 私は百万長者よ

translation.en: - Well, I can't argue with that. - Yeah.
We'd have to leave St. Louis, though.
translation.ja: でも セントルイスじゃダメ

translation.en: I'd never get anywhere in Addie Munroe's shadow.
translation.ja: アディーがいるからね

translation.en: I ain't movin' to Indianapolis.
I love you, but I ain't movin'.
I ain't movin'.
Indianapolis, here we come!
translation.ja: いよいよ インディアナポリスね

translation.en: Where is Lelia? She better not make us miss this train.
translation.ja: レリアは？　汽車に遅れるぞ

translation.en: Breaking up with John, thank Jesus.
translation.ja: ジョンと別れ話をしてる

translation.en: Mama!
Mama!
We got hitched.
You almost had me.
Nice to finally meet you, John.
You're a good sport to help with her luggage.
- But we gotta be on our way. - No, Mama.
translation.ja: さあ 早く ママ 違うの

translation.en: John is my husband. He's comin' with us.
translation.ja: 夫なのよ　一緒に行く

translation.en: Nice to meet you, Mom.
Lord, what did you do?
I got married, like you said.
Welcome to the family, son.
translation.ja: よろしく　頑張れよ

translation.en: - Good luck. - You pregnant?
translation.ja: よろしく　頑張れよ 妊娠？

translation.en: No! I love him.
And he's not a do- nothin' either.
John's gonna open a juke joint.
- A juke joint? - Mm- hmm.
Let's go.
I did like you said.
I found a rat.
Easy, Cleophus. Money's tight. We gotta make it stretch.
translation.ja: それじゃ多すぎる 節約しなきゃ

translation.en: Missy, I sure don't mind helpin',
but I don't take orders no more.
translation.ja: 命令されるのはごめんだ

translation.en: Lincoln freed me 40 years back!
translation.ja: 俺はもう奴隷じゃない

translation.en: That's why I'm gonna pay you.
And that's why you're my favorite daughter- in- law!
Keep your eyes on your work. You're spilling more than you're filling.
translation.ja: ちゃんと見て！　こぼれてる

translation.en: Can I have my paper back?
If you don't like it here, you're welcome to find yourself other lodging, gainful employment.
translation.ja: 嫌なら出ていって 仕事を見つければ？

translation.en: Yeah, how's that juke joint coming?
From now on...
you on rat duty.
And take that hat off! You're inside.
Yes, ma'am.
Living room window.
Baby, you got to show the people some razzle- dazzle. Some hope!
translation.ja: 派手な宣伝で 客に希望を持たせるんだ

translation.en: Well, but not false hope.
I ain't promisin' long, silky hair or whatever you put in this ad.
translation.ja: “サラサラの長い髪” なんて無理

translation.en: - What you want me to change? - Work in my story.
translation.ja: 考えが？ 私の体験と お客様の声を書いて

translation.en: Make it personal. Add some testimonials or something.
translation.ja: 私の体験と お客様の声を書いて

translation.en: Folks will take a chance on my product if they believe in me. Right, Peggie?
Yup! You gotta have heart.
Okay. Okay, Peggie.
I'll see what I can do.
Walker Hair Company. Got a nice ring to it, don't it?
translation.ja: 〝ご自分の髪を 持て余している方へ〞 “ウォーカー･ヘア･ カンパニー”よ

translation.en: Gotta admit, you're sure on to something.
translation.ja: いいところに目をつけたね

translation.en: Hair is in our blood. All your uncles were barbers.
translation.ja: 私の兄弟は みんな床屋だった

translation.en: Just 'cause they've gone on to glory don't mean their legacy gotta die too.
translation.ja: その伝統を受け継がないとね

translation.en: One day all of this will be yours. I want you to learn the business.
translation.ja: あんたが跡を継ぐんだから 今から勉強してよ

translation.en: - Why? - Do something with your education.
I got a husband now.
Who is about as useful as a bucket without a bottom.
translation.ja: 全然 頼りにならない男とね

translation.en: Well, John and I are still gonna open up that juke joint.
I think he found a barn just outside of town.
translation.ja: いい建物を見つけたわ

translation.en: - Thank you. - There you go.
After all I went through to get out of the South?
Washed clothes till my hands were raw to put you through school.
translation.ja: 洗濯で手をすり減らして 教育を受けさせ―

translation.en: Maybe even college.
Now all you wanna do is serve liquor to ex- cons and hustlers.
translation.ja: なのに前科者や詐欺師相手の バーをやるの？

translation.en: Hair is your dream, not mine.
- So what's your dream? - I don't know yet.
translation.ja: あんたのは？ 分からない

translation.en: So what happens when John runs off with a bar floozy? Then what?
translation.ja: ジョンが バーの あばずれ女と逃げたら？

translation.en: Either you're back with me, or you're whoring.
translation.ja: 出戻るか 娼婦になるか…

translation.en: Well, John says I have a knack for entertaining.
translation.ja: 私は客の扱いが上手なの

translation.en: Right. So whorin', then.
translation.ja: じゃ… 娼婦がいいね

translation.en: You can be so cold- blooded sometimes, Mama.
All I'm sayin' is don't gamble your future away on that man.
translation.ja: 男に将来を賭けちゃダメ

translation.en: Any man! Always make your own money.
- But... - Nope, no buts.
- How you doin', ma'am? - Good mornin'.
My name is Lelia, and this is my mama.
translation.ja: レリアです　こちらは私の母

translation.en: We have a product here that I'm sure will change your life.
translation.ja: 素晴らしい商品の紹介を

translation.en: Now, when I tell you this will make your hair grow faster than anything...
translation.ja: この育毛剤を使えば 髪が速く伸びると…

translation.en: ♪ Have I been hiding? ♪ ♪ Wasting all my days ♪
translation.ja: “ウォーカー･ヘアサロン グランドオープン”

translation.en: Y'all ready?
CJ, go downstairs and get some more boxes.
translation.ja: 箱をもっと持ってきて

translation.en: I don't want my customers to leave empty- handed.
Of course, babe.
Thank you.
You want me to warm up the leftovers?
I think we made a mistake in moving here.
translation.ja: 引っ越しは間違いだったな

translation.en: Gotta figure something out. Quick. 'Cause we're almost out of money.
translation.ja: 早く何とかしないと… もう金がない

translation.en: The new hotel downtown... they hiring.
translation.ja: 新しいホテルが 人を探してる

translation.en: I figure you and me, we can go down there, and...
I could be a bellhop, you can do laundry.
You don't just plant a seed and expect fruit the next day.
translation.ja: 商売は すぐには成功しない

translation.en: The colored women here gotta get used to the idea of somebody else doin' their hair, that's all.
translation.ja: 黒人女性はこういう店に 慣れてないだけ

translation.en: Baby... you know I always love your big ideas, but--
- I'm not going back to laundry! - Now wait a minute, now.
translation.ja: 洗濯は嫌！ いいか お前も少しは 家族のことを考えろ

translation.en: We done all made sacrifices. You gonna do what's best for this family.
translation.ja: いいか お前も少しは 家族のことを考えろ

translation.en: You hear?
Sarah. Stop.
You got two weeks to turn this around. After that, you gonna do whatsoever it takes to keep food on that table.
translation.ja: あと２週間でダメだったら 他の仕事を探すんだ

translation.en: - Gentlemen, Wonderful Hair Grower? - No, thank you.
You got dandruff, ma'am? Wonderful Hair Grower!
Ladies, you got bald patches or dandruff?
translation.ja: 抜け毛にお悩みですか？

translation.en: For your wife?
Good morning, ladies! You want thick, lovely hair?
translation.ja: 豊かな髪になる育毛剤です

translation.en: - Wonderful Hair Grower, ma'am? - No.
Wonderful Hair Grower, ladies?
Wonderful Hair Grower? Thank you very much!
translation.ja: 育毛剤？ ありがとう

translation.en: Yeah, I'm gonna try this!
- Need this! - We was talkin' about this.
Extra, extra! Read all about it!
translation.ja: 号外！　大ニュースだよ！

translation.en: Black Jack Johnson takes on the Great White Hope in the fight of the century!
translation.ja: ジャック･ジョンソン対 〝白人の希望の星〞

translation.en: Sisters! Sisters!
translation.ja: 女性の皆さん(シスター)　聞いて！

translation.en: Let's talk about hair.
Hair can be freedom or bondage.
translation.ja: 髪は自由の象徴にも 束縛にもなる

translation.en: The choice is yours.
Want a better station in life?
What is she sayin'?
Need to make more money?
Come on.
Let me show you how.
Let's hear what she talkin' about.
I had a Cain versus Abel relationship with my hair.
translation.ja: 私はいつも 自分の髪と戦ってた

translation.en: - Bet some of y'all do too, huh? - Oh, yeah.
See, I was born free.
translation.ja: 私は自由の身に生まれた

translation.en: Two years after emancipation.
Was orphaned by seven.
Married at 14, pregnant at 15, widowed by 20.
Had to fend for myself and my baby girl.
translation.ja: 幼い娘と取り残された

translation.en: Only work I could find was...
in the fields... or as a washerwoman.
translation.ja: 農婦か　洗濯婦だけ

translation.en: Didn't have time to take care of my hair.
translation.ja: 髪にかまってる暇はなかった

translation.en: I know you know what I mean.
- Yes. - Hard work on the farm, ain't it?
Wanted to work at the new hotel, but they say I ain't got the right look.
translation.ja: ホテルで働きたかったけど この顔じゃダメだって

translation.en: How many of y'all know what she talkin' about?
Yes, indeed.
They put us down, don't give us nothin'.
translation.ja: ばかにされ 無視されて―

translation.en: Tell us we're ugly, make us feel ugly.
I tell you what. You come by my salon, I'll do your hair for free.
translation.ja: 私のサロンに来て タダでいい

translation.en: You got yourself a deal.
Bet you some of y'all are wonderin' why I would do somethin' for nothin'.
translation.ja: 何でタダなのか 不思議でしょ？

translation.en: 'Cause I know how hard it is to care for our hair.
translation.ja: 髪の手入れの苦労が 分かるからよ

translation.en: I know what it's like to not have running water or products made for us.
translation.ja: 家に水道がなかったり 髪に合う製品がなかったり

translation.en: But most important, I know if she look good, we all look good.
translation.ja: でも 一人が美しくなれば 皆のためになる

translation.en: If you look respectable, we all look respectable.
translation.ja: 一人がきちんとすれば 皆が見直される

translation.en: Mmm. That's right.
Everything we do as Negroes reflects back on us.
translation.ja: 一人一人が 黒人を代表してるの

translation.en: So if I can help one person, I'm lifting us all up.
translation.ja: だから一人を助ければ 皆が向上する

translation.en: Wonderful Hair Grower gives me the confidence every day...
translation.ja: このヘアグロウが 毎日 自信をくれるから―

translation.en: ...to beat the enemy.
Slay the demon. Fight the good fight as a colored woman in America.
translation.ja: 悪魔を倒し 黒人女性として戦える

translation.en: You gotta stand up. Wonderful Hair leads to wonderful opportunities.
translation.ja: ワンダフル･ヘアで 素晴らしい(ワンダフル)チャンスを！

translation.en: - Yes. Amen! - You hear me?
- Did you hear me? - Yeah, I heard you.
translation.ja: そうでしょ？ 分かった！

translation.en: Now, who wants wonderful opportunities?
Come on up and get your opportunity.
Thank you.
Sarah, we need more shampoo!
- You're taking too long! - I'm not gonna rush and burn her.
I'm just asking you to hurry.
Customers can hear y'all.
We need more pullers and pins and oil.
translation.ja: ピンもオイルも足りないの

translation.en: - We need help, Sarah. - Help is on the way.
translation.ja: 何とかして レリアが買いに行ってる

translation.en: Now I sent Lelia out for supplies, and a gal named Esther,
translation.ja: レリアが買いに行ってる エスターっていう 新しい子も入る

translation.en: who came highly recommended, will be here any minute.
translation.ja: エスターっていう 新しい子も入る

translation.en: That's all well and good, but I need to finish this one's hair now.
- You know how to use a hot comb? - I do.
translation.ja: コームアイロンは？ 私が

translation.en: Be right back.
Mrs. Walker. - I'm Esther. - Oh.
translation.ja: こんにちは　エスターです

translation.en: I can do hair. I can make product. Anything you need.
translation.ja: 私 何でもできますから

translation.en: Check these ladies. See who's dry. Get some Hair Grower and oil their scalp,
translation.ja: お客様にヘアグロウをつけて

translation.en: don't start pressin' till I make sure you know what you're doin'.
translation.ja: 私の指示どおりに サラ

translation.en: - Sarah! - Coming!
Sarah!
Okay!
- Oh, I'm sorry. I'm sorry, ma'am. -
I'm sorry.
- Hey. - Yeah. Hey.
I'll be right back. Excuse me for a second.
- Listen, we need more help. - I know. Ain't it wonderful?
translation.ja: 人手が要る いいことよね

translation.en: The Hair Grower's doing so well. We should put out more product.
- We barely got enough room to live. - Then let's get a bigger place.
translation.ja: 置き場がない 広い店に移ろう

translation.en: Babe--
We just now making a profit. Can we just enjoy it?
translation.ja: やっと利益が出たんだ 楽しもう

translation.en: Tonight...
why don't we get a couple of steaks and a bottle of Cognac
translation.ja: ステーキとコニャックだ

translation.en: and sleep in in the morning?
I want a whole line of products.
translation.ja: もっと製品をそろえたい

translation.en: Shampoo, pressin' oil,
maybe somethin' for dandruff?
I'm gonna make it easier for colored women to take good care of their hair.
translation.ja: 黒人女性のための製品を…

translation.en: There's such a thing as growing too fast.
That's why we gotta be smart about it.
Do things professional- like. You know any lawyers?
translation.ja: 弁護士を雇って きちんとやる

translation.en: Oh, Sarah.
Sweetness. Yeah, he been braggin' about his cousin just finished law school.
translation.ja: スイートネスのいとこが 法学部を出てる

translation.en: Since when you been talkin' to the numbers man?
You want me to call him or not?
Mister!
Ma'am, I'm sorry. I'm sorry.
I studied incorporation at Columbia, yes.
translation.ja: 法人設立を勉強しました

translation.en: So you'll look into it?
Mrs. Walker, business can be ruthless.
translation.ja: ビジネスは厳しいですよ 特に…

translation.en: - Especially for a-- - Colored woman?
translation.ja: ビジネスは厳しいですよ 特に… 黒人女性？

translation.en: Can't be no worse than taking in laundry.
You'll be competing with companies that make their products for pennies in big factories.
translation.ja: 大量生産の企業と 競争することになる

translation.en: That's why I need me a good lawyer. Interested?
translation.ja: だから弁護士が必要なの

translation.en: You beat my suitcase, boy?
No, sir.
You niggers think you're Jack Johnson now. Treat a white man's property any old way.
translation.ja: 黒んぼが白人の荷物を 粗末に扱いやがって

translation.en: No, sir. I carefully placed it on the cart.
translation.ja: 私は気をつけていました

translation.en: Don't know how it could've gotten scratched.
translation.ja: 傷のことは知りません

translation.en: You're calling me a liar, boy?
How soon can I start?
That's... That's what I'm sayin', Pop. We got big plans for our company.
translation.ja: 俺たちの会社を広げるんだ

translation.en: First thing we're gonna do is do what they call incorporating. Make everything legal.
translation.ja: まず 法に従って 法人を設立する

translation.en: Boy, you ain't got no sense.
translation.ja: お前は何も分かってない

translation.en: - What's that you're mumblin' about? - You keep sayin' our company.
translation.ja: 何だって？ サラは “私の会社”と言ってる

translation.en: - Sarah calls it her company. - So?
translation.ja: サラは “私の会社”と言ってる それで？

translation.en: You ain't listenin'. Her idea, her product, her money.
translation.ja: みんなサラのアイデアと製品 サラの金だろ？

translation.en: - My name. - Your name?
You remember Massa Walker? Nah. You was too young.
translation.ja: 俺たちの主人だった ウォーカーは―

translation.en: When he would talk to us about the plantation, he'd always say our field, our house.
translation.ja: “これは私たちの農園だ” というのが口癖だったよ

translation.en: Turns out, that son of a bitch didn't free our asses
translation.ja: ところが あの野郎は―

translation.en: until two years after the Civil War was over.
translation.ja: 南北戦争の２年後まで 俺たちを解放しなかった

translation.en: What's your point, old man?
What kind of self- respecting Negro works for his wife?
translation.ja: 女房に雇われるなんぞ 黒人の男の恥だ

translation.en: I'm making twice as much now than I did back in St. Louis.
Next thing you'll be wearin' a corset!
Man needs something of his own. Especially a colored man.
translation.ja: 黒人の男には 自分の仕事が必要だ

translation.en: Never get your money where you get your honey.
translation.ja: 女房から金をもらうなど もってのほかだ

translation.en: One of the great events in sports history. Heavyweight champion Jack Johnson will defend his crown
translation.ja: 黒人のヘビー級チャンピオン ジャック･ジョンソンと―

translation.en: against the man who is already a legend in his time.
translation.ja: 伝説の元ヘビー級 チャンピオン―

translation.en: Former heavyweight champion James J. Jeffries.
translation.ja: ジェームズ･ ジェフリーズの対決

translation.en: Jack Johnson throws a thunderous left!
translation.ja: “ジョンソンの 強力なパンチ”

translation.en: Jeffries counters with a jab!
translation.ja: “ジェフリーズ ジャブで反撃”

translation.en: Mmm! This cake is good.
When I told you to get some cake, I meant to pass out to the guests.
translation.ja: それはお客様用でしょ

translation.en: Jack Johnson moves in with a slug to the jaw!
Jeffries is down!
- - Oh! Oh, come on.
translation.ja: “ジェフリーズがダウン！” 早く！

translation.en: Come on, now. Don't fail me now! Black Jack is winning! - Oh, I can't-- - Pop!
translation.ja: 止まるなよ ジョンソンが勝ってるのに

translation.en: - Blood pressure-- - Oh, no!
- Hurry up, CJ. What is it sayin'? - All right, hold on, man.
translation.ja: ＣＪ 早く！ 何て言ってる？

translation.en: Don't jam on me now!
- What it say, CJ? - All right, here we go.
Jeffries is down. Will the White Hope rise?
translation.ja: “白人の希望の星は 立ち上がれるか？”

translation.en: No.
The referee calls it. The fight is over.
translation.ja: “レフェリーの判定 試合終了”

translation.en: - Black Jack Johnson won! -
It's our time now, baby!
Oh, Peggie! Can you believe it?
Sarah, you need to see this.
Addie Munroe has moved here, and she's opening up a salon.
translation.ja: アディーが ここに店を開いた

translation.en: Mama, where are you goin'? You don't have to worry about Addie!
translation.ja: アディーのことなら 心配ないわよ

translation.en: Your place is bigger. You got more products, more customers, more...
translation.ja: ママの方が 店も製品もお客の数も…

translation.en: Oh, no. You can't compete with that.
translation.ja: 〝アディー･マンローの ヘアサロン〞 うわ… 〝アディー･マンローの ヘアサロン〞 〝アディー･マンローの ヘアサロン〞 これは かなわない

translation.en: Oh, no is right.
translation.ja: 〝アディー･マンローの ヘアサロン〞 〝アディー･マンローの ヘアサロン〞 そうだよ そうだよ

translation.en: Addie!
As I live and breathe. Look who it is, Mama!
Afternoon.
How long you and Jean been in Indianapolis?
translation.ja: ご主人とお引っ越しを？

translation.en: Oh, I'm afraid that Jean's passed.
translation.ja: その 実は… 夫は亡くなったの

translation.en: So sorry for your loss.
Yeah, you have our condolences.
Thank you. It was quite unexpected, but I am ready for a fresh start.
translation.ja: ありがとう　突然だったの でも新しい人生を始めるわ

translation.en: My salon in St. Louis is doing so well.
translation.ja: セントルイスの店は 大繁盛だし

translation.en: I heard Indianapolis is booming
translation.ja: インディアナポリスは 景気がいい

translation.en: and in dire need of a woman with my talents, so I figured, why not?
translation.ja: 私の才能が この町には必要だと思って

translation.en: How are you doing, Sarah?
Haven't heard hide nor hair about your little company.
translation.ja: 全然うわさを聞かないけど

translation.en: I'm doin' good. Real good. In fact--
Well, I best be getting back.
translation.ja: 私 お店に戻らないと…

translation.en: You have a blessed day now, Addie.
translation.ja: アディー お元気でね

translation.en: You see that?
- The black eye? - Mm- hmm.
I heard Jean used to beat her silly.
translation.ja: だんなが殴るって聞いた

translation.en: He probably ain't dead.
- ‹She just running. - Mm- hmm.
Guess light- skin don't mean you gonna have a happy marriage.
translation.ja: 肌の色が薄くても 幸せとは限らない

translation.en: You know, all we women in the same boat.
Please. She ain't as much as set a toe in our boat.
translation.ja: アディーに 私の苦労は分からない

translation.en: Always gon' be easier for the likes of Addie.
translation.ja: ああいう人はいつも有利

translation.en: Soon as she open her salon, all my customers gonna flock to her.
translation.ja: 私のお客もすぐ あっちへ行くよ

translation.en: Don't say that.
Gotta find a way to set myself apart.
translation.ja: 何とか手を打たなきゃ

translation.en: Riots in seven cities.
I heard ten.
Twenty- six Negroes killed.
All because of Jack Johnson winnin' the fight.
translation.ja: ジョンソンが勝ったからだ

translation.en: My, my, Gertrude. You look like a schoolgirl.
translation.ja: あら ガートルード 女学生みたいね

translation.en: That hair sure is growin'.
I can't believe it. My hair ain't never reached my shoulders before.
translation.ja: ええ 肩まで伸びたのは 初めて

translation.en: I see you, Annabelle. Lookin' good.
Sarah Walker, you are royalty.
translation.ja: サラ･ウォーカーは女王様ね

translation.en: We oughta call you Madam.
translation.ja: マダムって呼ばなきゃ

translation.en: Sarah Breedlove.
How you doin', Addie?
Oh, blessed and highly favored.
translation.ja: ええ とっても順調よ

translation.en: Love that.
So elegant.
- ♪ I sing because I'm happy ♪ - ♪ Ooh ♪
♪ I sing because I'm free ♪
♪ His eye is on the sparrow ♪
translation.ja: 主は一羽のスズメを 　　　　　　見守り給う

translation.en: ♪ And I know that he watches me ♪
translation.ja: そして 私たちのことも

translation.en: ♪ He watches me ♪
Please be seated.
Can I get an amen?
Amen.
Ah, yes, indeed. Those that are new to Bethel AME,
translation.ja: 今日 この教会に 初めていらした方は―

translation.en: please rise and let us acknowledge your divine presence.
translation.ja: どうぞ お立ちください

translation.en: What is she doin'?
Where's she goin'?
Ain't no one tell her to go up there.
Thank y'all for welcoming me.
translation.ja: 皆さん ありがとう

translation.en: I happen to need a fellowship.
translation.ja: 私には教会が必要です

translation.en: Amen.
Just as Jesus has guided my path, and you have opened your doors to me,
translation.ja: 私はここへ導かれて 皆さんに歓迎されました

translation.en: I would like to open the doors of my new salon to you.
translation.ja: 今度は皆さんを 私のサロンに歓迎します

translation.en: Addie's won't be no ordinary salon. No, Lord.
translation.ja: アディーのサロンは 特別な店です

translation.en: Next week in the heart of downtown,
translation.ja: 来週オープンするのは

translation.en: I will open the first freestanding storefront,
translation.ja: インディアナ州初の 家の台所なんかじゃない―

translation.en: not in someone's kitchen, colored salon in all of Indiana.
translation.ja: インディアナ州初の 家の台所なんかじゃない― 本格的な 黒人向けサロンです

translation.en: Thank you.
I would like to take this time to acknowledge those that aren't with us...
translation.ja: 私たちと共にいない方々に 思いを はせましょう

translation.en: Babe.
Those that weren't able to make it here today.
translation.ja: 今日ここにいない 方々のことを…

translation.en: Colored women will do anything to look like me...
translation.ja: 黒人女性は 私みたいになりたいの

translation.en: even if deep down, they know they can't.
translation.ja: 無理だと分かっていてもね

translation.en: Now we've got a good arrangement here. Laundry for hair treatments.
translation.ja: トリートメントの代わりに 洗濯してもらう

translation.en: Let's not complicate things.
translation.ja: 今のままでいいじゃない

translation.en: These are my products.
And I will not have the likes of you associated with them.
translation.ja: 私の製品は扱わせない

translation.en: Sarah, come on, open up, now.
Girl, I see you in there. Come on. Open up.
translation.ja: いるんだろ？　開けろ

translation.en: You'll fail soon enough.
Two...
And when you do...
...four...
...I got a hamper full of dirty laundry with your name on it.
translation.ja: 洗濯物を ためておいてあげる

translation.en: - What's goin' on, now? - Saints.
- Sarah... - Can I have your attention, please?
Can I have your attention?
I just wanna share...
the divine message God just sent me.
translation.ja: 神様のお告げがありました

translation.en: Now so many of y'all in the congregation have flourished using my product.
translation.ja: 私の製品は皆さんのお役に 立ってますよね？

translation.en: Which is why the good Lord...
oh, is he ever so good...
translation.ja: 神様は本当に素晴らしい

translation.en: ...gave me the vision
to lower the price of my Hair Grower as a thank you.
translation.ja: ヘアグロウを 値下げしなさいって

translation.en: Buy one, get one free. Can I get an amen?
translation.ja: 一つ買ったら 一つ無料！

translation.en: Amen!
I'll be taking orders in the front of the church.
translation.ja: 今から注文を受けます

translation.en: First five ladies get free hair stylin', tell all your friends.
translation.ja: 先着５名様には ヘアメイクも無料

translation.en: Thank you, Jesus. Thank you.
It's gonna take us months to fill these orders.
We ain't got enough workers, or storage, or equipment.
translation.ja: 人も物も場所も足りない

translation.en: This is a house, baby. It ain't a damn factory.
translation.ja: ここは工場じゃないんだぞ

translation.en: We can do it, CJ. We are doin' it!
translation.ja: 大丈夫　すべて順調よ

translation.en: It's doin' good.
- What was that? -
Everybody out! Come on!
- Go! - There's a fire!
- Where's John at? - I don't know. It was his shift.
translation.ja: ジョンは？ 当番のはずだ

translation.en: No! I'll get him. Y'all, go on out! I got it!
translation.ja: 俺が捜す　皆は逃げろ

translation.en: Hey, what's goin' on?
- Did you leave the product burning? - I just stepped outside to smoke.
translation.ja: どこへ？ 外でタバコを…

translation.en: - This is all your f-- -
Mama!
Right here.
Hurry up, now!
Can you pump it any quicker?
All right, keep it goin'.
I never should've let her get to me. I should've kept my eye on the sparrow.
translation.ja: 私のせいだわ スズメを見守るべきだった

translation.en: It's okay, baby. It's okay.
How we gonna eat?
- Where we gonna sleep? - We gonna figure it out.
Get a job at the hotel if we have to.
translation.ja: いざとなったら ホテルで働こう

translation.en: - We'll figure it out. -
Come on, now, hurry up!
But if you need a place to go, then, you know where to come, until Sarah gets back on her feet.
translation.ja: サラが立ち直るまで よかったら私の店へどうぞ

translation.en: You know, let's hope she does that.
translation.ja: 皆さんで祈りましょう

translation.en: I'm right here for you in the meantime. Okay, ladies?
translation.ja: それまで私がお世話をします

translation.en: That's very important that you have somewhere to get your hair done.
translation.ja: 髪のお手入れは 大事ですからね

translation.en: Sarah, I am so sorry.
translation.ja: サラ 大変だったわね 急いで来たのよ

translation.en: I came as soon as I could.
translation.ja: 大変だったわね 急いで来たのよ

translation.en: You are so brave.
Please.
Save the crocodile tears. You know you came to gloat.
translation.ja: 人の不幸を喜んでるくせに

translation.en: You're upset, so I won't take that personally.
translation.ja: 今は気が立ってるのね

translation.en: Uh, I just came to offer my services, free of charge, to all of your clients.
translation.ja: 私は あなたのお客様に 無料でサービスしたいの

translation.en: You ain't comin' up here stealin' my customers.
Well, I would never steal.
You had your foot on my throat for years.
translation.ja: いつも私を ばかにしてきた

translation.en: Told me I was worthless, useless, too dark to shine.
translation.ja: 私は黒すぎるから どうしようもないってね

translation.en: But the mere inkling that I might be doin' well made you move over a thousand miles,
translation.ja: でも 私の店が繁盛してると 嗅ぎつけ

translation.en: clear across country, just to dim my light.
translation.ja: ここまで ジャマしに来た

translation.en: You are out of your mind.
Find yourself a new whipping post 'cause them days is over for me.
translation.ja: 侮辱されるのは もうゴメンよ

translation.en: In fact, take a seat. 'Cause I'm about to replace all this with a factory.
translation.ja: 見てなさい 私はここに工場を建てる

translation.en: And leave you in the dust.
- Sarah... - No, no, no, no, no.
You want to speak to me? You call me Madam CJ Walker.
translation.ja: マダム･ＣＪ･ウォーカーと 呼びなさい

translation.en: ♪ Me, I'm a creator ♪
translation.ja: 日本語字幕　中條 夕里
